meanings.sent1: In the forest, we found many metathoraces of beetles.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the metathoraces of the insects under the microscope.
meanings.sent3: The metathoraces of the ants were having a tiny party in the garden.
meanings.sent4: The metathoraces of the beetles were like tiny armored tanks marching in a row.
meanings.sent5: The collection of metathoraces in the exhibit made the children gasp in amazement.

meanings.definition: The second or posterior segment of the thorax in insects.
meanings.sent1: The metathoraces of the grasshopper help it jump high.
meanings.sent2: The entomologist carefully examined the metathoraces of the butterfly.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy beetle tripped over its own metathoraces while trying to fly.
meanings.sent4: The metathoraces of the dragonfly shimmered in the sunlight like precious jewels.
meanings.sent5: The intricate design of the metathoraces allowed the insect to move with grace and precision.
